00033 # Description: Sends an syn to broadcast address, the destination host 
00034 #              cannot answer this send

00037 import unittest 
00038 from pcs.packets import ipv4
00039 from pcs.packets import tcp
00040 from pcs.packets import ethernet
00041 import tcptest
00042 import pcs
00043 
00044 class TestSendSyn4BroadcastAddress(unittest.TestCase):
00045     """
00046        Sends an syn to broadcast address, the destination host 
00047        cannot answer this send 
00048     """
00049 
00050     def setUp(self):
00051         """
00052         """
00053         import random
00054         
00055         #constants
00056         self.thisside = 0
00057         self.thatside = 1
00058 
00059         self.tcb = tcptest.tcb()
00060         
00061         self.tcb.ip = { self.thisside : pcs.inet_atol("10.211.55.210") , \
00062                     self.thatside : pcs.inet_atol("10.211.55.255")}
00063         
00064 
00065         self.tcb.ipid = { self.thisside : random.randrange(1,(1<<16)-1) , \
00066                       self.thatside : 0}
00067 
00068 
00069         self.tcb.tcpport = { self.thisside : random.randrange(50000,60000) , \
00070                          self.thatside : 9}
00071 
00072         self.tcb.tcpsequence = { self.thisside : random.randrange(1,(1<<32)-1),\
00073                              self.thatside : 0}
00074         
00075         
00076         self.tcb.ether = \
00077                 { self.thisside : ethernet.ether_atob("00:1c:42:9d:57:c9") , \
00078                   self.thatside : ethernet.ether_atob("00:1c:42:db:c5:22") }
00079 
00080 
00081         self.tcb.output = { self.thisside : pcs.PcapConnector("ed0") ,\
00082                         self.thatside : pcs.PcapConnector("ed0") } 
00083 
00084 
00085     def testSendSyn4BroadcastAddress(self):
00086         
00087         #THISSIDE
00088         (ipsyn, tcpsyn) = tcptest.createsyn(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, \
00089                                                       self.thatside)
00090         tcptest.createwritepacket(self, self.tcb, ipsyn, tcpsyn, self.thisside,\
00091                                                            self.thatside)
00092 
00093         print tcpsyn 
00094         print ipsyn 
00095 
00096 
00097     #
00098     #Receiving SYN+ACK
00099     #
00100 
00101         # adjusting tcb
00102         # I sent to broadcast, I don't wait for an answer,  but if there was 
00103         # one,it probability wiil have the receiver ip address as source address
00104         #todo:"think about enhance receive method, to receive more one case, may be tcb[]?!"
00105         self.tcb.ip[ self.thatside ] = pcs.inet_atol("10.211.55.220")
00106 
00107         #Receivinig anything 
00108         (ipsynack, tcpsynack) = tcptest.receive(self, self.tcb, self.thisside, \
00109                                                            self.thatside) 
00110 
00111         #what tests I will do?
00112         #->fail if receive a syn or ack
00113         #->accept an reset?
00114         #->waits the specified amount of time 
00115 
00116 if __name__ == '__main__':
00117     unittest.main()
